key_channel_insights.line_content: OTAs priced 85 % of itineraries above the MH website at a 9 % average markup and missed 14 % of offers—coverage shortfalls remain most acute outside Malaysia.
Metasearch engines undercut the website on 97 % of fares with a –0.20 % average discount and now display 100 % of offers, erasing prior availability gaps.
GDS still quotes higher prices 96 % of the time, yet the average markup has narrowed to +0.09 %, its lowest level in three weeks, signalling improving alignment.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTA fares exceeded the website on 85 % of itineraries last week, with an average 9 % markup (-1.3 ppts frequency WoW).
For searches >21 days out, OTA prices were higher 91 % of the time with a 12 % uplift—almost double the close-in gap.
83 % of non-Malaysia origin itineraries were absent from OTAs, limiting MH’s overseas reach.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 13.5 % of website itineraries were missing on OTAs, up 1.2 ppts WoW.
OTAs maintained a price premium in 84.5 % of cases; average uplift eased to 9 % from 15 %.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 84 % higher pricing with a 9 % premium; missing offers rose to 14 %.
97 % premium frequency but a smaller 5 % uplift; limited sample (2 ODs).

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: OTAs higher 93 % of the time, 9 % average premium; only 5 % missing content.
Coverage, not price, is the issue—83 % of itineraries missing; listed fares carry a 5 % premium.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Premium frequency 81 % with a 7 % uplift, down sharply from 16 % the prior week.
91 % higher-priced frequency and a stable 12 % premium.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSEs priced 97 % of MH itineraries below the website; no premiums recorded.
Average discount deepened to –0.20 %, a 3 bps erosion MoM.
‘Website offer not found’ fell to 0 %, restoring complete coverage.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Undercutting rose 9.4 ppts WoW; average discount –0.20 %.
Same-price cases fell to 2.9 % from 12 % last week.
All website fares now display on metasearch.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 97 % of ODs cheaper on MSE at –0.20 %; parity collapsed 9 ppts WoW.
100 % of sampled long-haul itineraries priced lower, sustaining the –0.20 % gap.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 92.7 % lower with a smaller –0.13 % gap; parity 7.3 %.

gds_highlights.line_content: GDS priced higher on 95.7 % of itineraries last week.
GDS-lower cases doubled WoW to 1.3 % of observations.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Dominant channel premium, though narrowing to +0.09 %.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Premium frequency 94 %, but 5.9 % of cases now cheaper with –0.25 % discount.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Higher pricing 96.3 % of the time, +0.09 % uplift; undercuts negligible (0.4 %).
Premium frequency drops to 89.7 %, and undercuts jump to 8.3 %.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Premium on 93.6 % of itineraries, small +0.07 % uplift; undercuts 1.6 %.
